We don't have Solaris 2.7.  Can you hack Text.createHandle() so that the call 
to XmCreateTextField takes a "new byte [1]" instead of null and tell me if the 
GP goes away?  If so, I will fix the code in HEAD.  Thanks.

We have tried the change in Text.createHandle(), but it still 
crashes at this place. 

That's how we changed the:
    System.out.println("Northover hack!");	
    handle = OS.XmCreateTextField (parentHandle, new byte [1], argList1,
argList1.length / 2);
    System.out.println("IS OK!");  

We tried with "null", "byte[1]" and "new byte[0]" and the output 
was always:

  Northover hack!
  IS OK!
  Northover hack!
  An unexpected exception has been detected in native code outside the VM.
  [the same stck trace as the reported one]

Interestingly, it seems to work fine the once and the second call 
to the method crashes.....

GG or FH, do you have any ideas?

Michael, does it always crash the second time, even without Northover hack.  
Something else for you to try is to always create a text control instead of a 
text field by hacking the line in createHandle() as follows:

if ((false && (style & SWT.SINGLE) != 0) {

Does Eclipse come up now?

We tryed different variations and it always crashed :-(. We also debugged it but
we could not find out what is going wrong....

Try not passing in the argList.  Does it still crash?

handle = OS.XmCreateTextField (parentHandle, new byte [1], null, 0);

Michael, are you still experiencing this problem with Eclipse 3.0 M9?

Grant, please follow this up with Michael.
I have to check, if we still try to run eclipse on solaris 2.7....
